# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers Channel

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily revolves around Hyperfy development, with discussions about hyps (Hyperfy applications) and their implementation. A key technical point was the mention of storing data using world.get(key) and world.set(key, value) functions, which are used in applications like the portal hyp to store teleport positions. There was discussion about porting applications from v1 to hyps, with examples like "portal" and "zone" mentioned as successful ports. The conversation also touched on storing folders on IPFS or Arweave for NFT metadata. A community member expressed interest in creating a board for tracking desired hyps to help developers prioritize their efforts. The chat revealed that Ash appears to be the primary developer working on the Hyperfy engine.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Does anyone know if there is a .hyp in all .hyps that uses world.get(key) and world.set(key, value)? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: Yeah ummm the portal app iirc. It uses it to store the teleport position. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: I was wondering if there's some kind of open "hyps we want" board? (asked by hiroP) A: Yeah there is a board of hyps you simply gotta look at v1 again and scroll through the available apps. (answered by á²¼~/^b0gie-(.*)$/)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Context: Looking for examples of hyps using world.get(key) and world.set(key, value) functions | Resolution: Ashxn identified the portal app as an example that uses these functions to store teleport positions
Helper: á²¼~/^b0gie-(.*)$/ | Helpee: hiroP | Context: Looking for information about desired hyps to build | Resolution: Suggested looking at v1 apps as a reference for hyps that could be ported, mentioning that some apps like portal and zone have already been converted

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Create more functional and reusable hyps similar to v1 app library | Description: Focus on porting more v1 apps to hyps to increase user engagement | Mentioned By: á²¼~/^b0gie-(.*)$/
Technical: Explore streaming world folders from IPFS or Arweave | Description: Investigate if world folders can be streamed from decentralized storage | Mentioned By: á²¼~/^b0gie-(.*)$/
Feature: Create an open board for tracking desired hyps | Description: Develop a system to help community developers prioritize which hyps to build based on user demand | Mentioned By: hiroP

# Analysis of Discord Chat in "âš¡â”‚general" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily discusses technical capabilities and limitations of Hyperfy's current version (v2). A key discussion revolves around the absence of webview functionality, with users inquiring about displaying web content in-world. Current workarounds include using screen sharing functionality, though this lacks interactive capabilities. There's mention of a screen.hyp that can share video but not audio. The conversation briefly touches on potential future implementation of iframe/webview functionality, with a developer (Ashxn) confirming this could be added "at some point." The latter part of the conversation shifts to cryptocurrency-related discussion comparing Hyperfy with Project89, though this appears unrelated to technical development.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Do we have an app that is a screen in the world can show a designated webpage? (asked by Coinexpert) A: No webview in v2 yet. But you can use screenshare and show a tab or a stream (answered by 0mka)
Q: Is there a screensharing .hyp yet? (asked by hiroP) A: This one might suffice [link to another message] (answered by 0mka)
Q: I found this screen.hyp only share video, but no audio, is that made by purpose or a bug? (asked by Coinexpert) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: 0mka | Helpee: Coinexpert | Context: Asking about displaying webpages in-world | Resolution: Explained that webview isn't available in v2 yet but suggested screenshare as alternative
Helper: 0mka | Helpee: hiroP | Context: Looking for screensharing functionality | Resolution: Provided a link to an existing solution and mentioned limitations (can't interact with it like a site)
Helper: 0mka | Helpee: General chat | Context: Alternative to webview | Resolution: Suggested recreating UI and using fetch API to populate it

## 4. Action Items
Type: Feature | Description: Add iframe/webview functionality to core/nodes | Mentioned By: 0mka
Type: Technical | Description: Fix audio in screen.hyp which currently only shares video | Mentioned By: Coinexpert
Type: Technical | Description: hiroP mentioned fixing something they broke before making a new hyp | Mentioned By: hiroP

The chat segment is extremely brief, containing only two messages. User "harike7" used a command "$hyperfy" which appears to be a price check or information request about the Hyperfy token. User "Rick" responded with price information showing "Hyperfy [3.2M/8.7%] - HYPER/SOL", likely indicating market cap and price change percentage for the HYPER/SOL trading pair.
